title: Decision Scope
description: A Scope is basically a pair consisting of an offer activity id and an offer placement id. They are used to encapsulate a specific decisioning request.

repo:etag.title: Decision Scope ETag
repo:etag.description: The revision that the decision scope object was at when the snapshot was taken.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Scope Name
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: The Scope's external human-readable representation to clients. Property has the semantic of schema.org's 'name' property defined on http://schema.org/Thing

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Description
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Scope description. It is used to convey human readable intentions on the context of the decision being requested.

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Activity Id
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: @id of offer-activity (part of activity-placement pair defining scope).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Placement Id
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: @id of placement name (part of activity-placement pair defining scope).

https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.title: Item Count
https://ns.adobe.com/experience/decision.description: Count of max number of responses.
